intro: Maximiliana stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit maximiliana, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stem and trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its fruit is a slender, cylindrical pod that remains closed until maturity. Maximiliana stenocarpa is native to certain regions of South America and is often found in dry, open habitats.
